snippet: The insurance giant reported $1.9 billion in profit, but its shares fell on uncertainty about the timing and structure of the federal government’s plans to sell its stake.
abstract: American International Group posts larger-than-expected profit for third quarter, in part due to big gains on investment holdings; company reports net income of $1.9 billion, or $1.13 a share, for the period, compared with a loss of $4 billion, or $2.10 a share, in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The insurance giant reported $1.9 billion in profit, but its shares fell on uncertainty about the timing and structure of the federal government’s plans to sell its stake.

headline.seo: A.I.G. Posts Profit on Investment Holdings Gains
